companions.name: Badger
companions.supportbenefit: Your badger digs around your foe’s position, interfering with its footing. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to a creature your badger threatens, the target can’t use a Step action (unless it can Step through difficult terrain) until it moves from its current position.

special.name: Badger Rage
special.text: The badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it fallsunconscious, whichever comes first. It can’t voluntarily stop raging. While raging, the badger is affected in the following ways.After it has stopped raging, it can’t use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.

companions.text: Your companion is a badger, wolverine, or other big mustelid.

companions.name: Bear
companions.supportbenefit: Your bear mauls your enemies when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the bear’s reach with a Strike, the creature takes 1d8 slashing damage from the bear. If your bear is nimble or savage, the slashing damage increases to 2d8.

special.name: Bear Hug
special.text: The bear makes another claw Strike against the same target. If this Strike hits, the target is alsograbbed, as if the bear had successfullyGrappledthe target.
special.requirements: The bear’s last action was a successful claw Strike.

companions.text: Your companion is a black, grizzly, polar, or other type of bear.

companions.name: Bird
companions.supportbenefit: The bird pecks at your foes’ eyes when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage a creature that your bird threatens also deal 1d4persistentbleed damage, and the target isdazzleduntil it removes the bleed damage. If your bird is nimble or savage, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d4.

special.name: Flyby Attack
special.text: The bird Flies and makes a talon Strike at any point along the way.

companions.text: Your companion is a bird of prey, such as an eagle, hawk, or owl.

companions.name: Camel
companions.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 80

special.name: Sand Stride
special.text: The camel Strides twice with a +5-foot circumstance bonus to Speed, ignoring difficult terrain caused by rubble, sand, and uneven ground made of earth and stone.

companions.supportbenefit: The camel makes a ranged attack to spit a long string of saliva at a foe within 10 feet. On a hit, the foe isdazzledfor 1 round.
companions.text: Your companion is a camel or llama

companions.name: Cat

special.name: Cat Pounce
special.text: The cat Strides and then Strikes. If it wasundetectedat the start of its Cat Pounce, it remains undetected until after the attack.

companions.supportbenefit: Your cat throws your enemies off-balance when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that deal damage to a creature that your cat threatens make the targetflat-footeduntil the end of your next turn.
companions.text: Your companion is a big cat, such as a leopard or tiger.

companions.name: Dromaeosaur
companions.supportbenefit: Your raptor constantly darts into flanking position. Until the start of your next turn, it counts as being in its space or an empty space of your choice within 10 feet when determining whether you and your companion areflanking; you can choose a different space for each of your attacks).

special.name: Darting Attack
special.text: The raptor Steps up to 10 feet and then Strikes, or Strikes and then Steps up to 10 feet.

companions.text: Your companion is a dromaeosaur (also called a raptor), such as a velociraptor or deinonychus.

companions.name: Horse

special.name: Gallop
special.text: The horse Strides twice at a +10-foot circumstance bonus to Speed.

companions.supportbenefit: Your horse adds momentum to your charge. Until the start of your next turn, if you moved at least 10 feet on the action before your attack, add a circumstance bonus to damage to that attack equal to twice the number of damage dice. If your weapon already has thejoustingweapon trait, increase the trait’s damage bonus by 2 per die instead.
companions.text: Your companion is a horse, pony, or similar equine.

companions.name: Hyena
companions.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 80
companions.supportbenefit: The hyena mockingly yowls at your enemies and bites at them when you create an opening. Until the start of your next turn, each time you hit a creature in the hyena’s reach with a Strike, the creature becomesfrightened 1.

special.name: Gnaw
special.text: The Strike’s target takes 1d6persistentbleed damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it removes the bleed damage. If the hyena is a specialized animal companion, the persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.
special.requirements: The animal companion’s last action was a successful jaws Strike.

companions.name: Snake
companions.supportbenefit: Your snake holds your enemies with its coils, interfering with reactions. Until the start of your next turn, any creature your snake threatens can’t use reactions triggered by your actions unless its level is higher than yours.

special.name: Constrict
special.text: The snake deals 12 bludgeoning damage to thegrabbedcreature; the creature must attempt a basic Fortitude save. If the snake is a specialized animal companion, increase this damage to 20.
special.requirements: The snake has a smaller creaturegrabbed.

companions.text: Your companion is a constrictor snake, such as a boa or python.

companions.name: Vulture
companions.source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 80

special.name: Feast on the Fallen
special.text: The vulture consumes a piece of the defeated foe, regaining 18 Hit Points. If the vulture is a specialized animal companion, increase the Hit Points regained to 30.
special.trigger: A creature adjacent to the vulture is reduced to 0 Hit Points

companions.supportbenefit: The vulture retches and vomits onto a foe within 10 feet. Until the start of your next turn, if you hit and deal damage to the target, the target must succeed at a Fortitude save or becomesickened 1(sickened 2 on a critical failure). The DC of the Fortitude save is 12 (or 14, if the vulture is a specialized animal companion) + your level + the vulture’s Constitution modifier.
companions.text: Your companion is a vulture, condor, or other large scavenging bird.

companions.name: Wolf
companions.supportbenefit: Your wolf tears tendons with each opening. Until the start of your next turn, your Strikes that damage creatures your wolf threatens give the target a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute (–10 on a critical success).

special.name: Knockdown
special.text: The wolf automatically knocks the target of its jaws Strikeprone.
special.requirements: The animal companion’s last action was a successful jaws Strike.

companions.text: Your companion is a wolf or other canine creature, such as a dog.
